00061 GJKCollisionDetector::GJKCollisionState::GJKCollisionState(ref<const Solid> solid1, ref<const Solid> solid2,
00062                  CollisionModel::CollisionModelType modelType)
00063   : CollisionState(solid1, solid2)

00077 ref<CollisionState> GJKCollisionDetector::newCollisionState(ref<const Solid> solid1, ref<const Solid> solid2) const
00078 {
00079   GJKCollisionState *sp = NewNamedObj("GJKCollisionState") GJKCollisionState(solid1, solid2, getType());
00080   return ref<GJKCollisionState>(sp);
00081 }
00082 
00083 bool GJKCollisionDetector::collision(ref<const Solid> solid1, ref<const Solid> solid2, CollisionQueryType queryType)
00084 {
00085   if (!collisionDetectionEnabled) return false;
00086   if (queryType == PotentialCollision) return true;
00087 
00088   // This must be called before GJK intersect/closest_points functions
00089   // to ensure that a GJKCollisionState for the pair has been created
00090 
00091   ref<GJKCollisionState> cs(narrow_ref<GJKCollisionState>(getCollisionState(solid1,solid2))); 
00092 
00093 
00094   // Do a pair-wise collision check
00095 
00096   ref<const GJKCollisionModel> model1 
00097     = narrow_ref<const GJKCollisionModel>(solid1->getCollisionModel(getType()));
00098   ref<const GJKCollisionModel> model2 
00099     = narrow_ref<const GJKCollisionModel>(solid2->getCollisionModel(getType()));
00100   
00101 
00102   // build a GJK Transform for each Solid
00103   gjk::Transform T1;
00104   T1.setIdentity();
00105   const Quat4& o1(solid1->getOrientation());
00106   gjk::Quaternion q1(o1.v.x, o1.v.y, o1.v.z, o1.w);
00107   T1.rotate(q1);
00108   const Point3& p1(solid1->getPosition());
00109   gjk::Vector t1(p1.x, p1.y, p1.z);
00110   T1.translate(t1);
00111   
00112   gjk::Transform T2;
00113   T2.setIdentity();
00114   const Quat4& o2(solid2->getOrientation());
00115   gjk::Quaternion q2(o2.v.x, o2.v.y, o2.v.z, o2.w);
00116   T2.rotate(q2);
00117   const Point3& p2(solid2->getPosition());
00118   gjk::Vector t2(p2.x, p2.y, p2.z);
00119   T2.translate(t2);
00120   
00121 
00122   gjk::Point v(cs->v.x, cs->v.y, cs->v.z); // get current collision state
00123 
00124   // perform collision check
00125   bool collided = intersect(*(model1->object), *(model2->object),
00126           T1, T2, v);
00127 
00128   if (!collided) {
00129     cs->v.x = v[0]; cs->v.y = v[1]; cs->v.z = v[2]; // update collision state
00130   }
00131   
00132 
00133   if (collided) {
00134 
00135     // construct contacts 
00136 
00137     /*    
00138     const DtScalar* p1 = collision_data->point1;
00139     const DtScalar* p2 = collision_data->point2;
00140     const DtScalar* n = collision_data->normal;
00141     Point3 cp1(p1[0],p1[1],p1[2]);
00142     Point3 cp2(p2[0],p2[1],p2[2]);
00143     Vector3 cn(n[0],n[1],n[2]);
00144     CollisionState::Contact contact(cp1, cp2,cn);
00145 
00146     cs->contacts.clear();
00147     cs->contacts.push_back(contact);
00148     */
00149     
00150     std::cout << "Collided.\n"; //  T1=\n" << T1.getBasis() << "\n:" << T1.getOrigin() << "\n";
00151   }
00152   else {
00153     std::cout << "No Collision\n"; // v=" << cs->v << std::endl;
00154   }
00155     
00156   return collided;
00157 }
